New Records: Mohammed Shami broke the record for the highest wicket-taker in ODI World Cups with 45 wickets.
India recorded their largest win in an ODI by 302 runs against Sri Lanka.
Key Match Events: India scored 357 for 8, their highest score in the 2023 World Cup.
Sri Lanka were dismissed for 55, their lowest total in the tournament.
Mohammed Shami took his second five-wicket haul in the World Cup.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka set India a target of 357 after being invited to bat first by Kusal Mendis.
India's batting lineup, including Shubman Gill, Virat Kohli, and Shreyas Iyer, showed exceptional form early in the innings.
Post-Match Reflections: India's players expressed pride in the team's resilience and performance.
The victory provided a significant morale boost ahead of the World Cup semifinals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.
The pitch offered plenty of runs, which India capitalized on effectively.
India's 302-run victory is one of their largest in ODI history.
Others: India became the first team to reach the semifinals of the 2023 World Cup.
The match highlighted the dominance of India's pace attack, particularly Mohammed Shami and Jasprit Bumrah.
